entry.title: Snow Expected in Southern Oregon Mountains as Cold Front Arrives Sunday Night
entry.summary: A cold front moving into southern Oregon Sunday night is expected to bring mountain snow into Monday morning. Most areas in the Cascades could see 4 to 6 inches, with a small chance of up to a foot. Snow levels may drop to around 4,500 feet overnight, potentially impacting higher elevation travel.

entry.title: Douglas County Fair Receives Six Western Fairs Association Awards
entry.summary: The Douglas County Fair received six 2025 Achievement Awards from the Western Fairs Association, including two first-place honors. Awards recognized advertising, photography and promotional efforts. The 2026 fair is scheduled for Aug. 5–8 in Roseburg.

entry.title: Federal Funding Approved for Oregon CASA Programs to Support Children in Foster Care
entry.summary: Oregon CASA programs will receive $1.031 million in federal funding for FY2026 to support volunteers who advocate for children in foster care. Officials say the funding will help stabilize programs after 2025 budget challenges and expand support for children across the state.

entry.title: Riverbend Live Seeks New Volunteer Leadership to Continue Beyond 2026
entry.summary: Riverbend Live in Winston is seeking new volunteer leadership to continue beyond 2026. Organizers say the 30-year concert and youth drama program can continue with new volunteers, but without them the long-running community tradition may end after the 2026 season.

entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products to Cut Jobs at Riddle Mill as Production Shifts to Support Engineered Wood Operations
entry.summary: Roseburg Forest Products is shifting specialty plywood production to its Coquille mill and reducing staffing by about 146 positions at its Riddle facility. The move supports expanded engineered wood operations and follows major investments to modernize mills and focus on core product lines.

entry.title: DINT Arrest: Man Jailed on Drug and Weapons Charges in Myrtle Creek
entry.summary: Detectives with the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team arrested 62-year-old William Pease late Feb. 3 in Myrtle Creek after locating nearly 98 grams of suspected methamphetamine and a concealed firearm in his vehicle. He was lodged in the Douglas County Jail on multiple drug and weapons charges.

entry.summary: January 30, 2026 — People’s Bank of Commerce is pleased to announce the promotion of Nikki Hoffman to Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer(COO), effective January 1, 2026. entry.title: PBCO Announces Cash Dividend
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 – PBCO Financial Corporation (OTCPK: “PBCO”), the holding company (Company) of People’s Bank of Commerce (Bank), today announced that it has declared a cash dividend of $0.25 per share, approximately 15% of 2025 net income. The $0.25 dividend will be paid on March 5, 2026, to shareholders of record February 18, 2026.… The post PBCO Announces Cash Dividend appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Some Umpqua National Forest sites move to cashless on April 1
entry.summary: All developed recreation sites operated by the Umpqua National Forest will transition to cashless fee collections through Scan and Pay or reservations on recreation.gov beginning April 1.

entry.title: Some Umpqua National Forest sites move to cashless on April 1
entry.summary: All developed recreation sites operated by the Umpqua National Forest will transition to cashless fee collections through Scan and Pay or reservations on Recreation.gov beginning April 1.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest Moves to Cashless Fees at Recreation Sites Starting April 1
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest will switch to cashless fee collection at developed recreation sites beginning April 1, 2026. Visitors will need to use Scan & Pay or Recreation.gov, with cash and checks no longer accepted at Forest Service sites.

entry.title: Police Log: February 2, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg Police responded to multiple incidents on Feb. 2, 2026, including several warrant arrests, a non-injury traffic crash, a prohibited camping citation, a parole violation, and a driving-while-suspended case. All information was released by RPD.

entry.title: One Person Found Deceased After Gunfire Reported in Sutherlin
entry.summary: Police responded to reports of gunfire in a Sutherlin neighborhood Monday afternoon. Officers later found an elderly woman deceased inside a residence. Authorities say there is no ongoing threat to the public.

entry.title: February 3, 2026
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: DEPUTIES INVESTIGATE HIT AND RUN CRASH
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 6:20 a.m. Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office investigated a hit and run crash on Sunday night. A DCSO report released on Monday said just after 6:00 p.m. said victims were notified that a vehicle had crashed into their property in the 2000 block of Driver Valley Road in the Oakland...

entry.title: SUTHERLIN POLICE RESPOND TO GUNSHOTS: ONE DECEASED FROM SELF-INFLICTED WOUNDS
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 4:00 a.m. Sutherlin Police and other agencies responded to reports of gunshots on Monday afternoon and eventually found one person that was deceased. Police Chief Troy Mills said at approximately 3:40 p.m. SPD officers with assistance of the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office and Oregon State Police were dispatched to the 1200 block...

entry.title: 2025 IN REVIEW: JOB LOSSES AND RISING UNEMPLOYMENT
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 3:50 a.m. Oregon’s labor force has grown slightly despite a negative turn in job growth. A State of Oregon Employment Department release said Oregon saw job growth in a handful of sectors and experienced a small increase in its labor force, but overall, the state lost jobs in 2025 as the unemployment...

entry.title: CITY OF MYRTLE CREEK ANNOUNCES A CHANGE IN FEBRUARY MEETINGS
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 3:40 a.m. The City of Myrtle Creek has announced a change in its schedule of public meetings for February. *The city council will hold a meeting Tuesday evening at 5:30 p.m. The Urban Renewal Agency will meet following the council meeting. *The mural committee has moved its meeting to Tuesday, February 10th...

entry.title: SUTHERLIN CITY COUNCIL MOVING TO MORNING MEETING FORMAT
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 3:30 a.m. The City of Sutherlin is moving its council meetings from evenings to mornings, starting next week. Drew Winkelmaier has the story: “Drew2” Q: News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN A city release said the transition will begin with the next council meeting, which will be held on Monday morning,...

entry.title: UNF DEVELOPED RECREATION SITES MOVE TO CASHLESS FEE COLLECTIONS
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 3:20 a.m. Starting in April, all Umpqua National Forest-operated developed recreation sites will transition to cashless fee collections through Scan & Pay or reservations through www.recreation.gov A UNF release said Scan & Pay allows visitors to pay on their mobile device for first-come, first-served campsites or activities via QR code instead of...

entry.title: RHS THEATER DEPARTMENT: “YOU’RE A GOOD MAN CHARLIE BROWN”
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 3:05 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Roseburg High School Theater Department will present, “You’re a Good Man, Charlie Brown” beginning February 27th. The synopsis said with charm, wit and heart, the production will celebrate the simple joys and everyday struggles of childhood through the bellowed characters of the Peanuts gang. Based...

entry.title: FRIENDS OF UV POLICE K9 PROGRAMS PRESENT HOPS FOR K9 COPS EVENT
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 2:50 a.m. Friends of Umpqua Valley Police K9 Programs presents the Hops for K9 Cops Event on Sunday, March 15th. It will take place at 2:00 p.m. at Backside Brewing Company on Northeast O’Dell Avenue in Roseburg. Attendees can meet the K9 teams and see demonstrations of what they can do. Pizza...

entry.title: New cashless system for Umpqua Forest recreation sites starts April
entry.summary: Starting April 1, Umpqua National Forest will transition all its developed recreation sites to cashless fee collections.
